meanings.definition: The ability of a material to conduct electricity when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: Photoconductivity allows certain materials to conduct electricity when light shines on them.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photoconductivity to understand how light affects the conductivity of different materials.
meanings.sent3: The photoconductivity of the solar panel made it the star of the energy efficiency fair.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a photoconductivity that brightened up the room like a beam of light.
meanings.sent5: The photoconductivity of the crystal was so strong that it seemed to glow from within when exposed to light.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which the electrical conductivity of a material increases upon exposure to light.
meanings.sent1: When light hits the material, photoconductivity causes its electrical conductivity to rise.
meanings.sent2: The photoconductivity of the semiconductor allows it to be used in light sensors.
meanings.sent3: The photoconductivity of the wire was so high that it lit up like a Christmas tree when the light turned on.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm had a photoconductivity that energized the whole team like a burst of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The photoconductivity of the circuit was so remarkable that it seemed to come alive under the light.
